interestingFact: Afghanistan is known as the 'Graveyard of Empires' due to its resistance to invasions.
Australia is home to more kangaroos than people.
Brazil is the only country in South America that speaks Portuguese.
Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world.
China is the most populous country in the world.
Egypt is home to the last surviving ancient wonder, the Great Pyramid of Giza.
France is the most visited country in the world.
Germany is home to the world's first printed book.
India is the largest democracy in the world.
Rome, Italy is home to the Vatican City, the smallest country in the world.
Japan is home to more than 6,800 islands.
Kenya is known for its rich wildlife and being the origin of the safari.
Mexico introduced chocolate, corn, and chilies to the world.
The Netherlands is famous for its windmills, tulips, and cycling.
New Zealand was the first country to allow women to vote.
Nigeria is the most populous country in Africa.
Pakistan has the second highest peak in the world, K2.
Russia is the largest country in the world by land area.
Saudi Arabia is the largest country in the world without a river.
South Africa has three capital cities.
South Korea is home to the world's fastest internet speeds.
Spain is known for its cultural festival 'La Tomatina' where participants throw tomatoes at each other.
Sweden is one of the world’s leading nations in sustainable energy.
Turkey is home to the ancient city of Troy.
